thread.title: Russia Offers to Set Up Helicopter Maintenance Center in Sri Lanka – Official
thread.title_full: Russia Offers to Set Up Helicopter Maintenance Center in Sri Lanka – Official

title: Russia Offers to Set Up Helicopter Maintenance Center in Sri Lanka – Official
text:
Russia Offers to Set Up Helicopter Maintenance Center in Sri Lanka – Official © AFP 2017/ Ishara S. KODIKARA Get short URL 0 7 0 0 A deputy chief of Russia’s Federal Service for Military-Technical Cooperation said that Russia has proposed to set up a service center for Russian-made helicopters in Sri Lanka. © Sputnik/ Maksim Bogovid Russia, Sri Lanka Discuss Delivery Contract of Gepard 3.9 Frigates LANGKAWI (Sputnik) – Russia has proposed to set up a service center for Russian-made helicopters in Sri Lanka, a deputy chief of Russia’s Federal Service for Military-Technical Cooperation told Sputnik on Friday. "We’ve submitted our proposals to equip a helicopter maintenance center and provide spare parts for armored hardware to the Sri Lankan side," the agency’s Mikhail Petukhov said at the LIMA 2017 military show in Malaysia. 
Sri Lanka has 12 Mi-8/17 military transport helicopters, six Mi-24P attack helicopters, 36 BMP-2 infantry fighting vehicles, and around 50 BTR-80 amphibious armored personnel carriers.
